protected_spaces_details.description: Provision for children and young people

description: Redevelopment (following demolition of existing industrial/ warehouse buildings) to provide a mixed use development of two buildings. Western block - up to six storeys: 33 affordable housing units (1, 2, 3 and 4 bedroom units) and site management office. Eastern block - up to eight storeys; 91 private residential units (1, 2 and 3 bedroom units), 589sq.m of office space (Use Class B1) and child care facility (Use Class D1) of 478sq.m. Vehicular access off Colonial Drive and provision of 12 disabled parking spaces and four integral cycle stores. Ground floor plant and refuse/recycling areas. Provision of footpath on north boundary to link Bollo Lane to Chiswick Business Park, associated public realm, landscaping and children's play space.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: SK120918_001 Site Location Plan 1:1000 A1 00; SK120918_002 Site Plan - As Existing 1:500 A1 00; SK120918_003 Site Plan - As Proposed 1:500 A1 00; SK120918_100 General Arrangement Plan - Ground Floor 1:250 A1 00; SK120918_101 General Arrangement Plan - First Floor 1:250 A1 00; PL_102 General Arrangement Plan - Second Floor 1:250 A1 16; PL_103 General Arrangement Plan - Third Floor 1:250 A1 16; PL_104 General Arrangement Plan - Fourth Floor 1:250 A1 16; PL_105 General Arrangement Plan - Fifth Floor 1:250 A1 16; PL_106 General Arrangement Plan - Sixth Floor 1:250 A1 15; PL_107 General Arrangement Plan - Seventh Floor 1:250 A1 15; PL_108 General Arrangement Plan - Eighth Floor - Roof 1:250 A1 15; PL_201 General Arrangement Sections - Section A-A; Section B-B 1:250 A1 15; PL_301 Contextual Elevations - North East & South West 1:500 A1 15; PL_302 Building Elevations - South West & North East 1:250 A1 15; PL_303 Building Elevations - South East & North West 1:250 A1 15; PL_401 Fatade Details - North East 1:50 A1 15; PL_402 Fatade Details - South West 1:50 A1 15; PL_501 General Arrangement Plan - Apt' Types A1, B4 & B4M 1:50 A1 15; PL_502 General Arrangement Plan - Apt' Types C1 & C1M 1:50 A1 15; PL_503 General Arrangement Plan - Apt' Types B2 & B3 1:50 A1 15; PL_504 General Arrangement Plan - Apt' Type C3 1:50 A1 15; PL_505 Wheelchair adaptable apartment - Apt' Types C1 & C1M 1:50 A1 00; PL_506 Wheelchair adaptable apartment - Apt' Types A4 & A4M 1:50 A1 00; PL_520 General Arrangement Plan - Apt' Type A3, A7 & B5 1:50 A1 15; PL_521 Wheelchair adaptable apartment - Apt' Type B6 1:50 A1 00; PL_550 General Arrangement Plan - Apt' Type B8 & D1 1:50 A1 16, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of proper planning and to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been, assessed against the Council's Adopted Development Plan. | Details (including samples where appropriate) of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, together with detailed design drawings of the ground floor northern elevations (active frontage) and wind mitigation screens, before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate for the development and the character of the area, to maximise the active frontage along the pedestrian realm and to mitigate against wind, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.3, 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.3 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until details of any external lighting associated with the development is designed in consultation with the London Wildlife Trust and is submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall be implemented as approved and retained for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the safety and amenity of future users and occupiers of the site and to prevent excessive light disturbance to the Gunnersbury Triangle Nature Reserve, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.3, 7.4, 7.5, 7.13, 7.18, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011; and 3.8, 3.9, 4.1, 4.4, 4.12 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 8 'Safer Ealing'. | Prior to first occupation of the development, a management and security strategy for the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy should include details of the following:  +	Details of site management procedures and security personnel; +	Details of the siting, height and nature of a closed circuit television network (CCTV); +	Details of 'secured by design' measures incorporated within the design of the development. +	Litter collection  The development shall thereafter be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved Management and Security Strategy, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason:  In the interests of the safety and security of the site and to ensure that satisfactory access is maintained for disabled people and people with pushchairs, in accordance with policies 3.1, 7.2 and 7.3 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.10, 4.1, 4.3 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 7 'Accessible Ealing' and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 8 'Safer Ealing'. | Prior to the commencement of development, an Environmental Management Plan (EMP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with The London Wildlife Trust and The London Borough of Hounslow.  The EMP shall include details of the following during development:  +	Details of demolition/land raising/construction hours; +	Dust suppression and monitoring measures, having regard to BRE guide 'Control of Dust from Construction and Demolition Activities'; +	Wheelwash measures; +	Noise mitigation and monitoring measures; +	Details of temporary lighting; +	Details of enclosure of working areas; +	A drainage strategy to operate setting out controls of contamination, including controls to surface water run-off, water pumping, storage of fuels and hazardous materials, spill response plans and pollution control measures; +	Pollution prevention and contingency measures; +	Construction traffic management proposals including details of delivery routes and HGV movements and details of any temporary site access/parking; +	Details of the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials.  Development works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved EMP unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of construction, in accordance with policies 2.1, 2.5, 2.6, 2.7, 3.8, 4.11, 4.12, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development, other than demolition and enabling works, shall commence until full details of the foul and surface drainage systems have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Thames Water and the Environment Agency. The details shall be implemented fully in accordance with the approved scheme prior to first occupation of the development unless an alternative timescale is agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that a sustainable drainage system is provided for the site accordance with Policy 5.13 of the London Plan 2011. | No impact piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling shall be carried out, including measures to minimise the potential for damage to subsurface water or sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the relevant water or sewerage undertaker. Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.  Reason: The proposed works would be in close proximity to underground water and sewerage utility infrastructure. | No development, other than demolition and enabling works, shall commence until  details of an impact study into the existing water supply have been submitted to and approved in writing (in consultation with Thames Water). The studies should determine the magnitude of any new additional capacity required in the system and a suitable collection point.  Reason: The existing water supply has insufficient capacity to meet the additional demands of the proposed development. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with The London Wildlife Trust and The London Borough of Hounslow, full details of proposed hard and soft landscaping works and all boundary treatment. The details shall include:  +	Detailed planting plans indicating plant species (including native species) and numbers for all landscaped areas, retained trees together with technical specifications for proposed green roofs and living walls; +	Details of hard landscaping, materials and construction specifications (including tree root protection measures where appropriate); +	Proposed measures to improve biodiversity (including design and location of bat, bird and insect boxes; +	Plans indicating the position, design, materials of all boundary treatment (walls, fences and gates, bollards) to be retained and erected; +	Details of external bicycle stands; +	Detailed design of proposed landscape buffer and boundary treatment along the southern boundary of the site to be agreed in consultation with London Wildlife Trust  This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The approved works and management plan shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and to enhance the biodiversity of the site and adjoining nature reserve, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.8, 3.9, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | A schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the proposed landscaping in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and to enhance the biodiversity of the site in the context of the adjoining nature reserve, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.8, 3.9, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | Notwithstanding the Arboricultural Survey Report submitted with the application, a Method statement to BS5837 2005 shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development (including demolition), to address the impact of the proposed development on trees on and adjacent to the site. The report shall include tree protection measures and a methodology for close monitoring of tree protection, including an initial inspection prior to any works (including demolition), unplanned monthly spot checks and supporting photographic evidence. The report shall also contain location details of below ground service runs. Where services enter the RPA of trees to be retained, the applicant must submit a construction method statement. The tree protection measures shall be carried out as approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To safeguard existing trees on and adjacent to the site, in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the environment, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.8, 3.9, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | Prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, an arboricultural site inspection report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The report shall contain the results of the initial inspection and monthly spot checks required by Condition 12 of this permission, together with supporting photographic evidence.  Reason:  To ensure that the approved tree protection measures have been implemented in accordance with condition 11 in order to safeguard existing trees on and adjacent to the site, in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the environment, in accordance with in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.8, 3.9, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | Details of the proposed children's play area identified on the approved plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include play equipment, landscaping, boundary treatment, disabled access and security measures and the condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The approved details shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of any part of the residential development hereby approved and retained for the life of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that adequate on-site space for young children to play is provided on site in connection with the proposed residential accommodation, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.6, 7.2 and 7.3 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.5, 4.3, 4.4, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the Servicing Management Plan contained within the Transport Assessment submitted with the planning application, A Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved. The plan shall address the following:  +	Deliveries and collections +	Servicing trips (including maintenance) +	Cleaning and waste removal +	Management of disabled parking spaces and drop-off areas (i.e. measures to ensure the spaces are reserved for disabled persons and to prevent unauthorised parking along the internal access road) +	Monitoring and review of operations +	The Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be implemented on first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety and to ensure that the proposed on-site parking provision is retained for disabled persons, in accordance with policies 6.11 and 6.12 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The proposed provision for refuse and recycling storage for the development shall be provided in accordance with the details shown on the approved drawings and in accordance with the Operational Waste Management Plan submitted with the application prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted, and shall be retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that adequate facilities refuse and recycling facilities are provided for the development, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 5.16 of the London Plan 2011 and policies with policies 2.10, 4.1, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards and the 12 proposed wheelchair accessible residential units detailed on the approved plans shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any part of the residential accommodation hereby approved and retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local planning Authority.  Reason: To increase the proportion of dwellings accessible to people with disabilities in line with the borough's needs, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and with policies 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Notwithstanding the Noise Assessment report submitted with the application, prior to the commencement of the development, details in line with the criteria specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category, the BS4142 rating noise. The details shall also include the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, including traffic, railway and commercial noise, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the Noise Assessment submitted with the application, prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from any proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained for the life of the plant and machinery.  Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, of the ceiling/floor separating the commercial parts of the premises from the dwellings, to demonstrate that the insulation is sufficient to prevent noise disturbance. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the Preliminary Environmental Risk Assessment submitted with the planning application, no development shall take place until an investigation and risk assessment is completed in accordance with a scheme to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site, together with any proposed remediation measures, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The report of the findings must include:  (i) a survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;  (ii) an assessment of the potential risks to:  +	Human health; +	property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes; +	adjoining land; +	groundwaters and surface waters; +	ecological systems; +	archaeological sites and ancient monuments.  (iii) an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s).  This must be conducted in accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency's Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11'. Any remediation scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.  The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development, other than that required to carry out remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.  Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous in the interest of public health and safety, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development  'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a validation report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced and submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.  Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous in the interest of public health and safety, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development  'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby permitted shall not be commenced until detailed design and method statements (in consultation with London Underground) for all of the foundations, and ground floor structures, or for any other structures below ground level, including piling (temporary and permanent), have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority which:  +	provide details on all structures +	accommodate the location of the existing London Underground structures +	demonstrate access to elevations of the building adjacent to the property boundary with London Underground can be undertaken without recourse to entering our land +	demonstrate that there will at no time be any potential security risk to our railway, property or structures +	accommodate ground movement arising from the construction thereof +	mitigate the effects of noise and vibration arising from the adjoining operations within the structures  The development shall thereafter be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved design and method statements, and all structures and works comprised within the development hereby permitted which are required by the approved design statements in order to procure the matters mentioned in paragraphs of this condition shall be completed, in their entirety, before any part of the building hereby permitted is occupied.  Reason: To ensure that the development does not impact on existing London Underground transport infrastructure, in accordance with London Plan policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2011. | Loading and deliveries to the commercial element of the development shall not take place outside the hours of 7.30am - 8.00pm Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 6.30pm on Saturdays and not at all on Sundays or public holidays.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the Sustainability Statement and Energy Strategy Report submitted with the application, prior to the commencement of the development other than site preparation, remediation and / or the formation of accesses, a detailed report and other supporting information providing details of the sustainability measures to be incorporated into the development which demonstrates that the development will achieve an overall (minimum) reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 25% (regulated carbon dioxide emissions) and a minimum of 17% (regulated and un-regulated carbon dioxide emissions) above Building Regulations 2010 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. In demonstrating compliance with the required percentage reduction in carbon dioxide emissions the applicant should consider the use of measures in line with the Mayor's Energy Hierarchy including the incorporation of on-site renewables. The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure that the development is energy efficient and contributes to reducing the need for fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Subject to the details of the Sustainability Statement and Energy Strategy Report secured under the relevant condition, details of the gas combined heat and power facility, including:  +	location; specification including size, operational data and operational performance, costs, QI rating, and suitable demand profiles for heating, cooling and electrical loads, and management strategy; +	details of the commercial operation of the CHP scheme +	details of communication with Energy Service Companies (ESCOs) +	flue location, height and design  shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any commencement of works on site and the facility shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such for the life of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure the facility is provided appropriately and so that it is designed in a manner which allows for the future connection to a district system in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.7, and 5.8 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the scheme of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 26.8kWp (equivalent to approximately 9.4% on-site C02 reduction to the non-residential development) as detailed within the Sustainability Statement and Energy Strategy Report, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the relevant part / phase of the development. The approved photovoltaic scheme shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the relevant phase / part of the development. The details shall include:  +	Details drawings of the resulting scheme; +	machinery/apparatus location associated with the photovoltaics; and +	specification, operational and cost details.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and maintained as such for the life of the development.  Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.7, and 5.8 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the proposed energy centre shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the works. The energy centre shall be installed and operational as approved prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter serve both domestic and non-domestic elements within the development unless an alternative energy strategy is otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include:  +	Location +	Floor area +	Space for additional plant to cover future expansion of the network  +	Pipework to be sized to enable future expansion of the network +	Plant to be housed in a way that will allow plant replacement and possibly the installation of new technologies, such as fuel cells or biomass CHP   Reason:  In the interest of securing the centralised energy centre for the site and its sustainable connection to the development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.1, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guide). No development shall commence on the development until evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and an Interim Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.   No residential dwelling shall be occupied in the development until Post-Construction Code for Sustainable Homes Review/Report has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures can be achieved.  Within 6months from the date of first occupation of the development a post construction stage certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been achieved. Such measures shall be retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.1, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Each non-residential building hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on BREEAM 2011 Technical Guidance).  At the same time as the details required pursuant to Condition 26 are submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, details of a 'Design Stage' assessment and related certification should be submitted.   Following the completion of the final non-residential building, a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and related certification confirming the BREEAM standard has been achieved, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing.   Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment
